publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1481# Mr David Davidson: Aid for the Scottish Fishing Sector-That the Parliament expresses its dismay at the outcome of the Fisheries Council; believes that the Scottish Executive, in conjunction with Her Majesty's Government, should formulate an aid package for both the catching and processing sectors of the fishing industry, and further believes that the Executive should work to reverse the movement of whiting processing to Denmark's industrial fishermen.
S1M-1481# Aid for the Scottish Fishing Sector (lodged on 18 December 2000) Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Bill Aitken*, Nick Johnston*

S1M-1481# Mr David Davidson: Aid for the Scottish Fishing Sector—That the Parliament expresses its dismay at the outcome of the Fisheries Council; believes that the Scottish Executive, in conjunction with Her Majesty's Government, should formulate an aid package for both the catching and processing sectors of the fishing industry, and further believes that the Executive should work to reverse the movement of whiting processing to Denmark’s industrial fishermen. Supported by: Mr Jamie McGrigor, Bill Aitken, Nick Johnston
S1M-1481# Aid for the Scottish Fishing Sector (lodged on 18 December 2000) Alex Johnstone*, Phil Gallie*, Mr Keith Harding*

S1M-1481# Mr David Davidson: Aid for the Scottish Fishing Sector—That the Parliament expresses its dismay at the outcome of the Fisheries Council; believes that the Scottish Executive, in conjunction with Her Majesty's Government, should formulate an aid package for both the catching and processing sectors of the fishing industry, and further believes that the Executive should work to reverse the movement of whiting processing to Denmark’s industrial fishermen. Supported by: Mr Jamie McGrigor, Bill Aitken, Nick Johnston, Alex Johnstone, Phil Gallie, Mr Keith Harding
S1M-1481# Aid for the Scottish Fishing Sector (lodged on 18 December 2000) Ben Wallace*

S1M-1481# Mr David Davidson: Aid for the Scottish Fishing Sector—That the Parliament expresses its dismay at the outcome of the Fisheries Council; believes that the Scottish Executive, in conjunction with Her Majesty's Government, should formulate an aid package for both the catching and processing sectors of the fishing industry, and further believes that the Executive should work to reverse the movement of whiting processing to Denmark’s industrial fishermen. Supported by: Mr Jamie McGrigor, Bill Aitken, Nick Johnston, Alex Johnstone, Phil Gallie, Mr Keith Harding, Ben Wallace
